page.title: 08PLACES OF WORSHIP
page.content: The religious needs of the area are served by the Anglican Church at Slimbridge and a Chapel at Gossington. The history of the Slimbridge Church is dealt with elsewhere, the Chapel at Gossington although looking very run-down from the outside is, in fact, regularly used by local inhabitants. Members of other religious groups have to travel to nearby towns to worship - Dursley, Stroud and Stonehouse. With the continued development of Slimbridge it is possible that in the not too distant future there will be a need for further religious building within the area although financial considerations might make this difficult.
